intro: Liparia rafnioides, commonly known as the slender lipara, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in shaded or partially shaded environments. It has finely divided, grass-like leaves and produces tiny, white to pale yellow blooms. Liparia rafnioides is often found in wetlands and is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
